definition: for a time/at one time/one time/once
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
to estimate/Taiwan pr. [duo4]
to have sexual intercourse (once)
once a year (every year)

sentences.english: The epidemic was stopped before the annual pilgrimage to Mecca got under way.
sentences.chinese: 这传染病在一年一度进行麦加朝圣之前停止。

sentences.english: The one hundred and first meridian was passed.
sentences.chinese: 现在已经越过了经线一百零一度了。

sentences.english: He was invited to present the prizes at the annual flower show.
sentences.chinese: 他受邀在一年一度的花展上颁奖。
李家山一度曾有600户居民。

sentences.english: The Shuanglong Lake is a shallow and urban lake, it had been a serious typical eutrophic lake.
sentences.chinese: 双龙湖是浅水型城市湖泊，一度为重富营养化湖泊。

sentences.english: The typewriter rescued him, at least for a time.
sentences.chinese: 打字机挽救了他，起码一度挽救过他。

sentences.english: At one point, he even demanded to know who was behind the killing of JFK.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至一度要求知道是谁策划谋杀了肯尼迪总统。

sentences.english: The first prize was awarded to the best competitor of the annual sports meeting .
sentences.chinese: 头奖颁给了这一年一度的运动会上最优秀的运动员。

sentences.english: Police suspect the girls were taken by their father.
sentences.chinese: 警方一度怀疑孩子们曾被其父亲协持。

sentences.english: The novel I had thrown away was chosen by the Book Society.
sentences.chinese: 我一度扔掉的那部小说后来被书社选中了。

sentences.english: The uterus contracted well with bleeding of 200ml, lst degree perineal was repaired.
sentences.chinese: 子宫收缩好，出血200毫升，会阴一度撕裂被修复。

sentences.english: The day after tomorrow, we will be celebrating the traditional Chinese holiday, the Mid-Autumn Festival.
sentences.chinese: 再过两天，就是一年一度的中国传统佳节中秋节。

sentences.english: York is the capital city of Yorkshire and was once known as England's "second" city.
sentences.chinese: 约克城是约克郡的首府，曾一度为英格兰第二大城市。

sentences.english: But how the human body is able to sense a one-degree change in temperature has remained a mystery.
sentences.chinese: 但人体如何感知一度的温度变化仍是个谜。

sentences.english: It is possible that at one time John was a member of the Judean Desert sect.
sentences.chinese: 有可能约翰曾经一度是那个小教派的成员。

sentences.english: After the explosion, Cheney said he was briefly moved to a bomb shelter.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生后，钱尼说，他一度被转移到防弹设施内。

definition: once more/once again/one more time
after this/afterwards/hereafter
even/so much so that
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
repeatedly/time and again
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
old variant of 卻|却[que4]
soon after
surname Ye
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
one more time/again/one more/once again
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
to be on the brink of/to be on the verge of
despite/although/even though/in spite of/unhesitatingly/do not hesitate (to ask, complain etc)/(go ahead and do it) without hesitating
straight (in a straight line)/continuously/always/from the beginning of ... up to .../all along
before this/before then/previously
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
a good thing doesn't last forever (idiom)
